intro: Dalechampia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian chuchuhuasi, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains compounds with potential medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary growth areas. Its ornamental value and traditional use in herbal medicine make it an important species in its native habitat.
